event: Our papers "API Misuse Detection via Probabilistic Graphical Model" and "Model-less Is The Best Model: Generating Pure Code Implementations to Replace On-device DL Models" have been accepted by ISSTA 2024 research paper track.
Our SANER'24 paper "Investigating and Detecting Silent Bugs in PyTorch Programs" won IEEE TCSE Distinguished Paper Award.
Our ICSE'24 paper "Modularizing while Training: A New Paradigm for Modularizing DNN Models" won ACM SIGSOFT Distinguished Paper Award.
our paper "ProveNFix: Temporal Property guided Program Repair" has been accepted by the FSE'24 research papers track.
our paper "Investigating White-Box Attacks for On-Device Models" has been accepted by the ICSE'24 research papers track.
our paper "Reusing Convolutional Neural Network Models through Modularization and Composition" has been accepted by TOSEM as research paper.
our paper "Automated Fixing of Web UI Tests via Iterative Element Matching" has been accepted by the ASE'23 research papers track.
our paper "Modularizing while Training: A New Paradigm for Modularizing DNN Models" has been accepted by the ICSE'24 research papers track.
our paper "ModelObfuscator: Obfuscating Model Information to Protect Deployed ML-based Systems" has been accepted by the ISSTA'23 technical papers track.
Binhang's paper Reusing Deep Neural Network Models through Model Re-engineering" has been accepted by the ICSE'23 technical track.
our paper "Template-based Neural Program Repair" has been accepted by the ICSE'23 technical track.
our paper "A Collaboration-Aware Approach to Profiling Developer Expertise with Cross-Community Data" has been accepted by the QRS'22 regular papers track.
Binhang's paper Patching Weak Convolutional Neural Network Models through Modularization and Composition" has been accepted by the ASE'22 research papers track.
Wang Jing has successfully defended her master thesis, and won Outstanding Graduates award of Beihang University. She is moving to Bank of China.
Yongqiang's work on developer portrait has beed accepted by Huawei OpenEuler Community.
our paper "Program Vulnerability Repair via Inductive Inference" has been accepted by the ISSTA'22 technical papers track.
our paper "Improving Fault Localization and Program Repair with Deep Semantic Features and Transferred Knowledge." has been accepted by the ICSE'22 technical papers track.
